definitions.text: any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
examples: the situation called for strong measures
the police took steps to reduce crime

definitions.text: the distance covered by a step
examples: he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig

definitions.text: the act of changing location by raising the foot and setting it down
examples: he walked with unsteady steps

definitions.text: support consisting of a place to rest the foot while ascending or descending a stairway
examples: he paused on the bottom step

definitions.text: relative position in a graded series
examples: always a step behind
subtle gradations in color
keep in step with the fashions

definitions.text: a short distance
examples: it's only a step to the drugstore

definitions.text: the sound of a step of someone walking
examples: he heard footsteps on the porch

definitions.text: a musical interval of two semitones
a mark of a foot or shoe on a surface
examples: the police made casts of the footprints in the soft earth outside the window

definitions.text: a solid block joined to the beams in which the heel of a ship's mast or capstan is fixed
a sequence of foot movements that make up a particular dance
examples: he taught them the waltz step

definitions.text: shift or move by taking a step
examples: step back

definitions.text: put down or press the foot, place the foot
examples: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread
step on the brake

definitions.text: cause (a computer) to execute a single command
treat badly
examples: This boss abuses his workers
She is always stepping on others to get ahead

definitions.text: furnish with steps
examples: The architect wants to step the terrace

definitions.text: move with one's feet in a specific manner
examples: step lively

definitions.text: walk a short distance to a specified place or in a specified manner
examples: step over to the blackboard

definitions.text: place (a ship's mast) in its step
measure (distances) by pacing
examples: step off ten yards

definitions.text: move or proceed as if by steps into a new situation
examples: She stepped into a life of luxury
he won't step into his father's footsteps
